Package it.polimi.ingsw.model.board

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.model.board.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    The Board is the space the game is played on.
    See Also:
    Cell

    • Field Detail

      • MAX_WEAPONS_PER_SPAWNPOINT

        private static final int MAX_WEAPONS_PER_SPAWNPOINT
        The maximum number of Weapons each Weapon shop can hold at any given time.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • game

        private Game game
        The Game the Board is pertaining to.

      • turnKillers

        private java.util.List<Player> turnKillers
        The list of Players who committed murder since the beginning of the current turn. Each Player appears as many times as the number of kills they were able to score.

      • killers

        private java.util.List<Player> killers
        The list of Players who committed murder since the beginning of the Game. Each Player appears as many times as the number of kills they were able to score.

      • doubleKillers

        private java.util.List<Player> doubleKillers
        The list of Players who killed two opponents in the same turn since the beginning of the Game. Each Player appears as many times as the number of double kills they were able to score.

      • cells

        private java.util.List<Cell> cells
        The list of Cells that make up the Board.

      • weaponDeck

        private Deck<Weapon> weaponDeck
        The Deck of Weapons.

      • powerUpDeck

        private Deck<PowerUp> powerUpDeck
        The Deck of PowerUps.

      • ammoTileDeck

        private Deck<AmmoTile> ammoTileDeck
        The Deck of AmmoTiles.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        private Board()
        This is the only constructor. It does nothing (thus creates an empty Board) and is inaccessible from outside this class. Creating a new board should be achieved by using the factory method generate(Game, int)

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public static Board generate​(Game game,
                             int type)
        This factory method creates a Board, based on the board type. It then binds the Board to a Game.
        Parameters:
        game - The Game the Board belongs to.
        type - The id of the board configuration.
        Returns:
        a newly generated Board.

      • buildBoard

        private static java.util.List<Cell> buildBoard​(DecoratedJsonObject jBoardSet,
                                               int boardType)
        This factory method constructs an object with the properties found inside the JSON object passed as argument.
        Parameters:
        jBoardSet - the JSON object containing the list of Boards, each with the desired properties.
        boardType - The id of the board configuration.
        Returns:
        an instance of this class in accordance with the specified properties.

      • getCellByCoordinates

        public Cell getCellByCoordinates​(int xCoord,
                                 int yCoord)
        Finds the Cell whose coordinates are equal to those passed in as arguments.
        Parameters:
        xCoord - The horizontal coordinate of the Cell.
        yCoord - The vertical coordinate of the Cell.
        Returns:
        the Cell at the given coordinates, or null if no Cell is at the given coordinates.

        public void promoteDoubleKillers()

        See Also:
        turnKillers, doubleKillers

        public Game getGame()
        Returns the Game that is being played on the Board.
        Returns:

      • spreadAmmo

        public void spreadAmmo()
        Spreads ammo on every AmmoCell of the Board. More specifically, for each AmmoCell that does not contain any AmmoTile, a new AmmoTile is drawn from the AmmoTile Deck and placed onto that Cell.
        See Also:
        ammoTileDeck

      • spreadWeapons

        public void spreadWeapons()
        Spreads Weapons on every SpawnCell's Weapon shop. More specifically, for each SpawnCell that contains fewer Weapons than the maximum allowed amount, a new Weapon card is drawn from the Weapon Deck for each free slot in the shop, to which the Weapon is added. This method stops having an effect once the Weapon Deck has been depleted.
        See Also:
        weaponDeck, MAX_WEAPONS_PER_SPAWNPOINT

      • scoreUponGameOver

        public void scoreUponGameOver()
        Awards Players with points from the ScoreList, with the Players ranked best to last according to amount of kills (overkills are worth two kills), with ties broken in favour of the Player who made the first kill the earliest. One additional point is awarded to each Player for each double kill they were able to perform during the Game.
        See Also:
        countKills(Player)

      • countKills

        private int countKills​(Player author)
        Counts the equivalent number of kills a Player scored during the Game. Overkills are counted as two kills.
        Parameters:
        author - the Player on whom to count the kills.
        Returns:
        the number of equivalent kills.

      • fetchWeapon

        public java.util.Optional<Weapon> fetchWeapon​(java.lang.String name)
        Searches through the Weapon Deck until it finds a Weapon with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the Weapon.
        Returns:
        An optional containing that Weapon, if found, otherwise an empty optional.

      • fetchPowerUp

        public java.util.Optional<PowerUp> fetchPowerUp​(java.lang.String type,
                                                java.lang.String color)
        Searches through the PowerUp Deck until it finds a PowerUp with the given type and colour.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of the PowerUp.
        color - the colour of the PowerUp.
        Returns:
        An optional containing that PowerUp, if found, otherwise an empty optional.

      • fetchAmmoTile

        public java.util.Optional<AmmoTile> fetchAmmoTile​(int red,
                                                  int yellow,
                                                  int blue,
                                                  boolean includesPowerUp)
        Searches through the AmmoTile Deck until it finds an AmmoTile with the given properties.
        Parameters:
        red - the amount of red cubes on the AmmoTile.
        yellow - the amount of yellow cubes on the AmmoTile.
        blue - the amount of blue cubes on the AmmoTile.
        includesPowerUp - whether or not the AmmoTile includes a PowerUp.
        Returns:
        An optional containing that PowerUp, if found, otherwise an empty optional.
